utterances: Let's give it a shot, Will.
David, I'm going to give you some five-letter words.
For each one, insert two letters between the first and second letters to make a familiar seven-letter word.
For example, if I said elate, E-L-A-T-E, you would insert an M, U to make emulate.
And this answer is something I think you are.
(Laughter) Put two consonants between the S and the O.
Gland - G-L-A-N-D, as in the liver.
It may take me a fortnight to figure this one out.
It's a consonant, vowel in that order.
Fraught - no. This is a tough one.
The first letter is a vowel and then a consonant.
And your last one is feign - F-E-I-G-N.
Oh, man, David, you are great.
That was just, like, no big deal for you, just knocked them out.

David Lefkowitz of Los Angeles, Calif.
